metadata.name: MMC Spawning Windows Shell
metadata.comment: Detects a Windows command line executable started from MMC

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\\\mmc.exe')) AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\cmd.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\pwsh.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\wscript.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\cscript.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\sh.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\bash.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\reg.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\regsvr32.exe'))) AND contains(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\bitsadmin')))

output.summary: Detects a Windows command line executable started from MMC

metadata.objective: Examine fields: process.cmd_line, process.name, process.parent_process.cmd_line Reference: https://enigma0x3.net/2017/01/05/lateral-movement-using-the-mmc20-application-com-object/
